events.event_name: Nomination of Kevin Warsh as Federal Reserve chair
events.description: President Donald Trump nominated Kevin Warsh to lead the Federal Reserve.
A series of employment data points released during the week.
The European Central Bank and Bank of England held their policy rates steady.
Upcoming elections in Japan affecting the yen's performance.

facts.fact_text: The dollar index traded just below 98 on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: The dollar index traded just below 98 on Friday

facts.fact_text: President Donald Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Federal Reserve chair.

evidences.evidence_text: President Donald Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Federal Reserve chair

facts.fact_text: The ECB and BOE kept policy rates unchanged.

evidences.evidence_text: ECB and BOE kept policy rates unchanged

claims.claim_text: A broad selloff in stocks, commodities, and cryptocurrencies boosted demand for the dollar.

evidences.evidence_text: a broad selloff in stocks, commodities, and cryptocurrencies boosted demand for the currency

claims.claim_text: US jobs data pointed to signs of a slowing labor market.

evidences.evidence_text: a series of US jobs data this week pointed to signs of a slowing labor market

claims.claim_text: Markets currently price in two rate cuts this year, starting in June.
claims.author: Markets

evidences.evidence_text: Markets currently price in two rate cuts this year, with the first expected in June and a second potentially in September

claims.claim_text: Kevin Warsh's nomination eased concerns about the Fed's independence.

evidences.evidence_text: The nomination also eased concerns about the Fed’s independence

evidence.evidence_text: The greenback has gained sharply since President Donald Trump nominated Kevin Warsh
US jobs data this week pointed to signs of a slowing labor market, supporting dovish bets on Fed policy
strengthened the most against the yen ahead of Japan’s lower house elections
a broad selloff in stocks, commodities, and cryptocurrencies boosted demand for the currency
